title: Startups Rush to Count Company Carbon Emissions
sub_head: Regulators and investors are increasingly demanding better greenhouse-gas data, including from supply chains
body:
A company that can measure the carbon footprint of Parmesan shavings for a salad maker was valued at $1 billion by its investors last month.
Watershed Technology Inc. sells software that allows companies to quickly work out their environmental impact. That information is in high demand for investors and increasingly by regulators, creating a hot but already crowded market.
